speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Sirrah, you giant, what says the doctor to my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: water?

speaker: PAGE
text: He said, sir, the water itself was a good healthy

speaker: PAGE
text: water, but, for the party that owed it, he might have

speaker: PAGE
text: more diseases than he knew for.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Men of all sorts take a pride to gird at me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The brain of this foolish-compounded clay, man, is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not able to invent anything that intends to laughter

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more than I invent, or is invented on me. I am not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: only witty in myself, but the cause that wit is in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: other men. I do here walk before thee like a sow

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that hath overwhelmed all her litter but one. If the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Prince put thee into my service for any other reason

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: than to set me off, why then I have no judgment.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thou whoreson mandrake, thou art fitter to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: worn in my cap than to wait at my heels. I was never

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: manned with an agate till now, but I will inset you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: neither in gold nor silver, but in vile apparel, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: send you back again to your master for a jewel. The

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: juvenal, the Prince your master, whose chin is not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: yet fledge—I will sooner have a beard grow in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: palm of my hand than he shall get one off his cheek,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and yet he will not stick to say his face is a face

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: royal. God may finish it when He will. ’Tis not a hair

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: amiss yet. He may keep it still at a face royal, for a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: barber shall never earn sixpence out of it, and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: he’ll be crowing as if he had writ man ever since his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: father was a bachelor. He may keep his own grace,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: but he’s almost out of mine, I can assure him. What

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: said Master Dommelton about the satin for my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: short cloak and my slops?

speaker: PAGE
text: He said, sir, you should procure him better

speaker: PAGE
text: assurance than Bardolph. He would not take his

speaker: PAGE
text: band and yours. He liked not the security.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let him be damned like the glutton! Pray

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: God his tongue be hotter! A whoreson Achitophel, a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rascally yea-forsooth knave, to bear a gentleman in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hand and then stand upon security! The whoreson

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: smoothy-pates do now wear nothing but high shoes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and bunches of keys at their girdles; and if a man is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: through with them in honest taking up, then they

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: must stand upon security. I had as lief they would

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: put ratsbane in my mouth as offer to stop it with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: “security.” I looked he should have sent me two-and-twenty

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: yards of satin, as I am a true knight, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: he sends me “security.” Well, he may sleep in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: security, for he hath the horn of abundance, and the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lightness of his wife shines through it, and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cannot he see though he have his own lantern to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: light him. Where’s Bardolph?

speaker: PAGE
text: He’s gone in Smithfield to buy your Worship a

speaker: PAGE
text: horse.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I bought him in Paul’s, and he’ll buy me a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: horse in Smithfield. An I could get me but a wife in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the stews, I were manned, horsed, and wived.

speaker: PAGE
text: Sir, here comes the nobleman that

speaker: PAGE
text: committed the Prince for striking him about

speaker: PAGE
text: Bardolph.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Wait close. I will not see him.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: What’s he that goes there?

speaker: SERVANT
text: Falstaff, an ’t please your Lordship.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: He that was in question for the robbery?

speaker: SERVANT
text: He, my lord; but he hath since done good

speaker: SERVANT
text: service at Shrewsbury, and, as I hear, is now going

speaker: SERVANT
text: with some charge to the Lord John of Lancaster.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: What, to York? Call him back again.

speaker: SERVANT
text: Sir John Falstaff!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Boy, tell him I am deaf.

speaker: PAGE
text: You must speak louder. My master is deaf.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: I am sure he is, to the hearing of

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: anything good.—Go pluck him by the elbow. I must

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: speak with him.

speaker: SERVANT
text: Sir John!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What, a young knave and begging? Is there

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not wars? Is there not employment? Doth not the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: King lack subjects? Do not the rebels need soldiers?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Though it be a shame to be on any side but one, it is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: worse shame to beg than to be on the worst side,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: were it worse than the name of rebellion can tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: how to make it.

speaker: SERVANT
text: You mistake me, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why sir, did I say you were an honest man?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Setting my knighthood and my soldiership aside, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: had lied in my throat if I had said so.

speaker: SERVANT
text: I pray you, sir, then set your knighthood and

speaker: SERVANT
text: your soldiership aside, and give me leave to tell you,

speaker: SERVANT
text: you lie in your throat if you say I am any other than

speaker: SERVANT
text: an honest man.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I give thee leave to tell me so? I lay aside that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: which grows to me? If thou gett’st any leave of me,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hang me; if thou tak’st leave, thou wert better be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hanged. You hunt counter. Hence! Avaunt!

speaker: SERVANT
text: Sir, my lord would speak with you.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Sir John Falstaff, a word with you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My good lord. God give your Lordship good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: time of the day. I am glad to see your Lordship

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: abroad. I heard say your Lordship was sick. I hope

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: your Lordship goes abroad by advice. Your Lordship,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: though not clean past your youth, have yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: some smack of an ague in you, some relish of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: saltness of time in you, and I most humbly beseech

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: your Lordship to have a reverend care of your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: health.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Sir John, I sent for you before your

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: expedition to Shrewsbury.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: An ’t please your Lordship, I hear his Majesty

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: is returned with some discomfort from Wales.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: I talk not of his Majesty. You would not

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: come when I sent for you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And I hear, moreover, his Highness is fallen

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: into this same whoreson apoplexy.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, God mend him. I pray you let me

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: speak with you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: This apoplexy, as I take it, is a kind of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lethargy, an ’t please your Lordship, a kind of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sleeping in the blood, a whoreson tingling.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: What tell you me of it? Be it as it is.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: It hath it original from much grief, from

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: study, and perturbation of the brain. I have read the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cause of his effects in Galen. It is a kind of deafness.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: I think you are fallen into the disease,

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: for you hear not what I say to you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Very well, my lord, very well. Rather, an ’t

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: please you, it is the disease of not listening, the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: malady of not marking, that I am troubled withal.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: To punish you by the heels would amend

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: the attention of your ears, and I care not if I do

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: become your physician.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am as poor as Job, my lord, but not so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: patient. Your Lordship may minister the potion of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: imprisonment to me in respect of poverty, but how

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I should be your patient to follow your prescriptions,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the wise may make some dram of a scruple,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: or indeed a scruple itself.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: I sent for you, when there were matters

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: against you for your life, to come speak with me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: As I was then advised by my learned counsel

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in the laws of this land-service, I did not come.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, the truth is, Sir John, you live in

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: great infamy.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: He that buckles himself in my belt cannot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: live in less.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Your means are very slender, and your

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: waste is great.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would it were otherwise. I would my means

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: were greater and my waist slender.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: You have misled the youthful prince.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The young prince hath misled me. I am the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fellow with the great belly, and he my dog.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, I am loath to gall a new-healed

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: wound. Your day’s service at Shrewsbury hath a

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: little gilded over your night’s exploit on Gad’s Hill.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: You may thank th’ unquiet time for your quiet

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: o’erposting that action.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My lord.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: But since all is well, keep it so. Wake not

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: a sleeping wolf.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: To wake a wolf is as bad as to smell a fox.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: What, you are as a candle, the better

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: part burnt out.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A wassail candle, my lord, all tallow. If I did

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: say of wax, my growth would approve the truth.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: There is not a white hair in your face but

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: should have his effect of gravity.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: His effect of gravy, gravy, gravy.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: You follow the young prince up and

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: down like his ill angel.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Not so, my lord. Your ill angel is light, but I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hope he that looks upon me will take me without

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: weighing. And yet in some respects I grant I cannot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: go. I cannot tell. Virtue is of so little regard in these

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: costermongers’ times that true valor is turned bearherd;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pregnancy is made a tapster, and hath his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: quick wit wasted in giving reckonings. All the other

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gifts appurtenant to man, as the malice of this age

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shapes them, are not worth a gooseberry. You that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: are old consider not the capacities of us that are

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: young. You do measure the heat of our livers with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the bitterness of your galls, and we that are in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: vaward of our youth, I must confess, are wags too.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Do you set down your name in the scroll

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: of youth, that are written down old with all the

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: characters of age? Have you not a moist eye, a dry

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: hand, a yellow cheek, a white beard, a decreasing

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: leg, an increasing belly? Is not your voice broken,

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: your wind short, your chin double, your wit single,

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: and every part about you blasted with antiquity?

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: And will you yet call yourself young? Fie, fie, fie, Sir

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My lord, I was born about three of the clock

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in the afternoon, with a white head and something

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a round belly. For my voice, I have lost it with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: halloing and singing of anthems. To approve my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: youth further, I will not. The truth is, I am only old

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in judgment and understanding. And he that will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: caper with me for a thousand marks, let him lend

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me the money, and have at him. For the box of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ear that the Prince gave you, he gave it like a rude

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: prince, and you took it like a sensible lord. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: checked him for it, and the young lion repents.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
Aside
                .
                 
              Marry, not in ashes and sackcloth, but in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: new silk and old sack.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, God send the Prince a better

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: companion.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: God send the companion a better prince. I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cannot rid my hands of him.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, the King hath severed you and

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Prince Harry. I hear you are going with Lord John

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: of Lancaster against the Archbishop and the Earl of

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Northumberland.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, I thank your pretty sweet wit for it. But

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: look you pray, all you that kiss my Lady Peace at

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: home, that our armies join not in a hot day, for, by

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the Lord, I take but two shirts out with me, and I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: mean not to sweat extraordinarily. If it be a hot day

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and I brandish anything but a bottle, I would I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: might never spit white again. There is not a dangerous

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: action can peep out his head but I am thrust

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon it. Well, I cannot last ever. But it was always

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: yet the trick of our English nation, if they have a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good thing, to make it too common. If you will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: needs say I am an old man, you should give me rest.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would to God my name were not so terrible to the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: enemy as it is. I were better to be eaten to death

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: with a rust than to be scoured to nothing with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: perpetual motion.

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Well, be honest, be honest, and God

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: bless your expedition.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Will your Lordship lend me a thousand

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pound to furnish me forth?

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: Not a penny, not a penny. You are too

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: impatient to bear crosses. Fare you well. Commend

speaker:
CHIEF
               
              JUSTICE
text: me to my cousin Westmoreland.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: If I do, fillip me with a three-man beetle. A

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: man can no more separate age and covetousness

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: than he can part young limbs and lechery; but the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gout galls the one, and the pox pinches the other,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and so both the degrees prevent my curses.—Boy!

speaker: PAGE
text: Sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What money is in my purse?

speaker: PAGE
text: Seven groats and two pence.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I can get no remedy against this consumption

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of the purse. Borrowing only lingers and lingers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: it out, but the disease is incurable.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Go bear this letter to my Lord

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of Lancaster, this to the Prince, this to the Earl

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of Westmoreland, and this to old Mistress Ursula,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: whom I have weekly sworn to marry since I perceived

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the first white hair of my chin. About it. You

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
know where to find me.
                 
                Page
                 
                exits
                .
                 
              A pox of this

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gout! Or a gout of this pox, for the one or the other

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: plays the rogue with my great toe. ’Tis no matter if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do halt. I have the wars for my color, and my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pension shall seem the more reasonable. A good wit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: will make use of anything. I will turn diseases to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: commodity.
